issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
Steps performed prior to this issue:
a) create a volume, attached and write 500mb random data
b) create 10 snapshots and 1 volume from each snapshot
c) attached all 10 volumes and mount couple of random volume to check md5sum of data
d) detached all the volumes and wait for all volume to go to _available_ state
e) then deleted all 10 volume at once

cloud-output.log on SC (cluster 'one'):
{noformat}
2015-01-09 02:44:39 ERROR 000001260 BlockStorageController   | Failed to lookup snapshots marked for deletion

fields.summary: Deleting multiple volumes stuck at 'deleting' state

comments.body: I have the setup as it is. please let me know if someone wants to take a look

[~shaon], I'd like to take a look, it seems like this may be due to:

If so this is a general issue with Transactions rather than a storage specific issue.
The transaction issue that may be the root cause is now fixed in the testing branch.
Thanks [~sjones], I will check with the latest packages.
